intro: Haplopteris reekmansii, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery fronds. The plant has a unique reproductive system, with spores produced on the underside of its fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
